thread.title: ‘I’m gonna shame these bastards on Facebook’
thread.title_full: ‘I’m gonna shame these bastards on Facebook’

title: ‘I’m gonna shame these bastards on Facebook’
text:
Dodgiest park ever: Brisbane beautician on mission to shame drivers on Facebook Liz Burke news.com.au Dodgiest park ever: Brisbane beautician on mission to shame drivers on Facebook Liz Burke news.com.au This dodgy parking picture has been shared on Facebook more than 17,000 times. 
ALMOST every day for the past five years Nicole Tishler has sat at the manicure table of her Brisbane beauty salon helplessly watching selfish drivers take advantage of the disabled parking spots outside her business. 
That was until last week, when a customer at an adjoining business parked his car across not one but two of the special parks and she’d just had enough. 
“It’s definitely not the first time it’s happened, it’s all the time. But I just thought, I’m going to shame these selfish bastards on Facebook,” she told news.com.au. 
The 44-year-old business owner said she confronted a man in a green sedan outside the small Kingston shopping complex on Wednesday when he left his car illegally parked over the two special spots while waiting in line at the nearby post office. 
After he refused to move she snapped a picture and posted it for Facebook captioned: “check out this looser. Not only 1 disabled park but 2 ... Then he informed me I was scumbag for taking the photo.” 
“He said ‘I don’t care, dob me in’, so I thought mate, this is it,” she tells news.com.au. Other Stories
